channel.title: Tinkering with Linux
channel.description: Recent content on Tinkering with Linux

item.title: Installing and using multiple versions of a library
item.description: I use a Haskell static website generator called yst for generating my homepage. Why? Partly because when I first created my professional webpage, I was a Haskell enthusiast and yst seemed cool. After a while, I got frustrated with Haskell (I use Arch Linux, and it seemed that each upgrade would break Haskell install) and moved on. I haven’t used Haskell for a while now.

item.title: Rofi Selectors
item.description: rofi is perfect for creating interactive scripts, which I like to call rofi selectors. Here are some examples:
